*div1 type="summary"* *p*R. Hawes to Austin [about September 14, 1832]. Concerning settlement of the Hawkins estate.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[About September 14, 1832.]*/p* *p*Mr *person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir, I avail myself of an opportunity afforded through *person_mentioned*Col. John Thompson Mason*/person_mentioned* of addressing you on the subject of the interest of *person_mentioned*Hawkins heirs*/person_mentioned* in the *location_mentioned*Texas property*/location_mentioned*. I will thank you to confer with *person_mentioned*Mr. Mason*/person_mentioned* and between you devise some plan to relieve you from the unpleasant situation which from your letter to me through *person_mentioned*Mr. Mason*/person_mentioned* you state that you are placed in relation to this property. I am from every information I have, disposed to do in the matter so far as my power extends whatever you and *person_mentioned*Mr. Mason*/person_mentioned* may think I ought or can do. Please if you chalk out a course to give me the forms of the transaction which would be authentic in your country— I deputed*person_mentioned* Mr. Martin*/person_mentioned* to act as *person_mentioned*agent*/person_mentioned*, but I have not heard a word from him.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*R. Hawes*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*This letter is directed to *person_mentioned*Mr Mason*/person_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Cincinnati Ohio*/location_mentioned*, who has proffered to bear it*/p*.
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col. John T. Mason*/person_mentioned* Care of*person_mentioned* Major Henrie Innkeeper *location_mentioned*Cincinnati Ohio*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
